1.brief: to clatter, i.e. slap (the hands together), clang (an instrument); by analogy, to drive (a nail or tent-pin, a dart, etc.); by implication, to become bondsman by handclasping)
a cornet (as giving a clear sound) or curved horn
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
to mar (especially by breaking); figuratively, to split the ears (with sound), i.e. shout (for alarm or joy)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
to quiver (with any violent emotion, especially anger or fear)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

2.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
duskiness, figuratively, misfortune; concrete, concealment
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud
gloom (as of a lowering sky)
dawn (literal, figurative or adverbial)
to break apart, disperse, etc.
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

powerful (specifically, a paw); by implication, numerous

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
a year (as a revolution of time)
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling

properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
properly, to lick, i.e. (by implication) to blaze

the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
a view (the act of seeing); also an appearance (the thing seen), whether (real) a shape (especially if handsome, comeliness; often plural the looks), or (mental) a vision
a steed (as stretched out to a vehicle, not single nor for mounting ); also (by implication) a driver (in a chariot), i.e. (collectively) cavalry

to run (for whatever reason, especially to rush)

the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)

properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

28.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to spill forth (blood, a libation, liquid metal; or even a solid, i.e. to mound up); also (figuratively) to expend (life, soul, complaint, money, etc.); intensively, to sprawl out
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
to prophesy, i.e. speak (or sing) by inspiration (in prediction or simple discourse)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
properly, to bind firmly, i.e. (by implication) to be (causatively to make) plump; also (through the figurative sense of dumbness) to dream
properly, selected, i.e. a youth (often collective)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

29.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a female slave (as a member of the household)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to spill forth (blood, a libation, liquid metal; or even a solid, i.e. to mound up); also (figuratively) to expend (life, soul, complaint, money, etc.); intensively, to sprawl out
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)

30.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a miracle; by implication, a token or omen
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
smoke, literally or figuratively (vapor, dust, anger)

31.brief: the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten

32.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)

Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine

deliverance; concretely, an escaped portion
